Award.AwardTitle: NSF National Robotics Initiative (NRI) 2017 PI Meeting

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration: The objective of this award is to organize the annual Principal Investigators (PI) meeting for the National Robotics Initiative (NRI), which was launched in 2011. The PI meeting brings together the community of researchers, companies, and program officers who are actively engaged in the NRI to provide cross-project coordination in terms of common intellectual challenges, methods for education and training, best practices in education, technology transfer and general outreach, and a centralized and lasting repository illustrating the research ideas explored and milestones achieved by the NRI projects. The meeting will be two days in November 2017 in the vicinity of Washington DC. The format will include short presentations by all the attending PIs, a poster session, keynote speeches, and panel discussions. Invitations to the meeting will include all PIs with active NRI grants, program managers with robotics-related programs, and members of the press.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The objective of the National Robotics Initiative PI Meeting is to bring together the community of researchers, companies and program managers that are actively engaged in the National Robotics Program that was launched during 2011. The first projects were launched in fall, 2012, and it is considered important to build a community across the projects in terms of sharing of research results, best practices in terms of education and training, opportunities for exploitation of results and mechanisms for broader impact.

The 2017 meeting followed the successful blueprint of the 2014, 2015 and 2016 meetings, with the following results: 1) Fostered awareness and communication between NRI teams, many of whom employ complementary or competing approaches to related problems; 2) Offered a forum for demonstrating and sharing best practices in education, technology transfer, and general outreach; 3) Provide concentrated opportunities to share NRI successes with the media and other government agencies; and 4) Established a forum for representing and illustrating the research ideas explored by and milestones achieved by NRI projects over the past year.

The main motivation behind this meeting is to provide a basis for community building across the set of sponsored projects to maximize impact of the research, to optimize educational effort and to strengthen the broader impact. As an example, this is an ideal venue for inviting members of the press to see results from the program. The motivation is to present cutting edge research, to provide a basis for community sharing, for considering best practices in research, dissemination, and translation of research.
